Saw this projection on the USA Covid epdimiology projection. 50% of 320 million gets infected. That‚Äôs 160 million. 80% mild to moderate and recover. 20% critical. That‚Äôs 16 million. About . 0.5 To 1% of 160 million can die. At .5 about 800000 can die.  Apllying to SL 5000 can theoretically die . This is just the first wave. This just stresses the importance of precautions, testing to ID and control measures since no one has immunity and there is no vaccine. Don‚Äôt be foolish to think that SL is doing great. This is the tip of an iceberg.

Just watch some international news and try to appreciate the efforts made by all relevant officials to keep this pandemic at this level in Sri Lanka. Recovery rate (deaths to recovery in Sri Lanka is 14.2 in here while it is 1.5 in the US. True that the government messed it up by not closing the airport in time while believing WHO. The biggest issue as you mentioned was keeping offices for nominations. However, just think about a situation where the nominations were not called and the previous parliament is standing now. No relief measure with the forces could have been done if so.

Recovery rates are calculated by deaths /total confirmed x100. according to epidemiology statistics. By that calculation the SL has around 93%. Your calculation of recovered / death I simply not correct. However, there are many caveats in calculating a recovery rate as the pandemic is ongoing. The sample size is too small in SL as the disease is still spreading. The asymptomtaic population currently is thought to be around 25% , so they don‚Äôt get counted in the confirmed numbers. It is too early for any statistical analysis as community spread has just begun in SL. Wait and see when the curve has flattened.

It is now clear that the current outbreaks are largely due to infected sailors visiting their homes. It is also evident that there has been inadequate social distancing and other precautions in the camps as the sailors would have been directly in contact with infected persons (e.g Keselwatta). What is unfortunate is that they were allowed to go to other provinces without quarantine which is denied to other citizens.This is a major failure of the navy management.
